name: Glenmoriston Town House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Glenmoriston for one night in February 2010, and had a magic time. we had a superior room overlooking the river with modern furniture, an extremely comfortable bed, and a massive bathroom.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely, and also enjoyed a nice candlelit dinner at the Abstrakt restaurant downstairs. Would defintely stay here again, but would be paying the extra to stay in the superior room onve again.
reviews.title: WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and i booked a stay at the Glenmoriston May bank holiday to celebrate our 5Th wedding anniversary. The location of the hotel is ideal on the banks of the ness river with lovely views. Unfortunately the problems started when we went to check in at 4pm as advised on our arrival an hour earlier. When reception staff were presented with the pre paid hotel voucher it was noted that there was no record of our reservation.(The hotel booking was made through travel republic) We were asked to wait in bar area. Fortunately we were lucky to receive the last room in the hotel or not as the stay progressed (Room no 1). The room we were given was a standard room similar to what we had booked. It was extremely small,cluttered,dated and not in the best repair i.e broken tiles in the bathroom. Room security was poor with one flimsy lock insitu. I personally did not feel safe in the room. The room adjacent and upstairs was noisey when they flushed their toilet or turned their taps on a huge racket could be heard. As we were celebrating our wedding anniversary i had pre booked dinner in Abstract restaurant in the hotel.The menu choice was fair. The food quality was good, its presentation fair. We were given complementary food items in between courses. Between each course there was a considerable wait. Do not eat here unless you have lots of time on your hands and expect poor service. From starters to completion of desert took approx 2.5 hours. However when you ask for the bill and it doesn't arrive 30 minutes later and you haven't been asked if you drinks would like to replenished we left the restaurant. In the bar area we ordered post dinner drinks and for the restaurant bill. The bar staff alerted the manager on duty. We explained what had happened.Apologies were given and told that it would be followed up. Complemantry drinks were provided however still no restaurant bill appeared. We were asked by hotel manager to eat in other retaurant in the hotel the next evening where he would personally look after us. The next evening we decided to eat early 6pm booking. The service to begin with was satisfactory even though the restaurant was very quiet and their was only one waiting staff. Menu choice good. Food quality good. We had starters, main course and asked to see dessert menu. After 45 minutes we managed to get the attention of the only waiter and asked for the bill. which was incorrect as were charged for drinks ordered which never got to our table.Well where do i begin with breakfast the next morning. Terrible service for start to finish. Ordered the full cooked breakfast. Delicious. Continental buffet selection poor. No cold meats or cheese to choose from. Poor bread selection unless you ate sliced bread or croissants only. On our last morning breakfast experience didn't improve was told no brown bread available in the hotel as it didn't get delivered. There ars lots of small shops within hotel proximity where brown bread could be purchased. Upon check out lots of unhappy people checking out complaing about poor service and lack of staff in the hotel. We checked out of the hotal swiftly as possible not wanting to spent another moment there. Did get to see final sum for our restaurant bill from first night but no breakdown. Will definately not be returning or recommending to friends or family .will be advising against them staying here. In my opinion hotel does not deserve to keep its current star rating without lots of imput from management to improve this hotel overall.
reviews.title: Too Expensive for what it is....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for the weekend, booked through laterooms at £75/night, but was forced to pay the at upgrade of £30 because the reserved room was really cramped. The room were extremely basic and for 4* this was not right. We ended up with a family room in an attic conversion, which again was fairly small - I'd hate to have 4 people in it! I have stayed in several hotels of all class and 2* guesthouses have been on par. Beds were extremely uncomfortable, far too soft, left bones aching next day.
reviews.title: perfect night's sleep.......

reviews.text: Nevertheless, the dining areas and bar have nice modern decor and breakfast was varied and nice. Staff could not have been more friendly or helpful and I cannot fault them on this.
reviews.title: Excellent food and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to arrival, this hotel assisted me with a few questions and when we arrived, we were quickly checked-in. Going to their Piano Bar we were pleasantly surprised and impressed with the decor and charming bar staff; along with their cocktail and whisky list - which were extensive. Their food (of which we had some starters) was mouthwatering and due to the late hour, quickly served. Alas that was the highlight of our stay; with the service letting it down greatly in terms of forgetting to book our taxi to the airport (even though we had requested it and seen the receptionist write it down) to the lack of knowledge of the local area (was misinformed of where one of my town appointments was) to the horrendous one hour wait for our lunch on the Sunday and we had to push to get it within that time frame! So, be prepared for long waits between being sat down, given a menu, having your order taken and actually eating. If it wasn't for that, I would have thought about returning to this hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful food but a real shame about the service

reviews.text: Let there be no doubt, the Glenmoriston is a very comfortable, hospitable, clean hotel - but you would expect it to be for £135 a night. Indeed that would be the absolute minimum for that kind of price.
reviews.title: Expensive - Hidden Extras - bad value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the unwary traveller should beware of this hotel. The rooms are small, cramped and littered with furniture. Soundproofing is non-existant, and if you are given a room near the restaurant, you will hear immediately who the life and soul of the party is.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the thing that got me most annoyed was the hidden charges for internet usage. The Wifi is available throughout the hotel, and most devices and laptops will detected the unlocked signal. However one has to sign in using a password and user name, available from reception. What reception fails to advise is you will be charged for internet use.
reviews.title: Either over-priced, or under-nice

reviews.text: I have no problem paying for internet - I do have a problem paying for it when I am not told about that charge, and I am already paying a rate far in excess of similar rated hotels in the vicinity.
reviews.title: OK only
DON'T STAY AT THE GLENMORISTON
reviews.text: When I arrived at the hotel after a long day. The receptionist informed me they had booked me in to another hotel as the room allocated to me had 'plumbing problems'.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The car park was empty, I'm sure another could have been allocated.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The hotel I was allocated to was a bit run down but they gave me the best room they had which I have to say was fantastic and the staff were very pleasant.
reviews.title: Cramped attic bedroon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have also heard from another source that the Glenmoriston pull this stunt on a regular basis.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in August for 2 nights. Location and service is great. Staff very pleasant.Our room was very clean, however I was a little disappointed with the interior for a four star hotel. Breakfast excellent. Would probably still stay here again if returning to Inverness because of the location.
reviews.title: Cramped. OK. Expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here a couple of times. The rooms in the main part are a little tired, but comfy beds and large windows. Overall, lovely service, great food and friendly bar for late night drinks. A good option when in Inverness
reviews.title: Decent hotel, with nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great stay at the Glenmoriston. Stayed at many hotels in Inverness and this is one of the top best stays. Hotel is centrally located, Clean. Breakfast was first class from the buffet to the full scottish. Staff friendly and helpful. Stayed in an Executive room which overlooked the river which was lovely. Bed very comfy and the rooms have top quality furnishings. Well recommended and are returning again in April.
reviews.title: Excellent - Top hotel in Inverness

reviews.text: I have stayed in Inverness regularly for the past 16 months and this is my favourite hotel. It delivers a consistently good standard. The beds are comfortable and I get good sleep- a priority for me, its warm in the winter and the break! Lovely staff and quality food.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: wonderful hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Our room was very comfortable, a little small but not too bad. We had a meal in the restaurant and it was delicious. Overall our staff was A+
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having entered the Loch Ness marathon I was looking for a convenient b&b to stay for one night, but after trying countless places, none were interested in my wife and I only booking for one night.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better

description: The Glenmoriston Town House Inverness is a stylish four star deluxe property on the banks of the River Ness, perfectly located within the heart of the capital of the highlands it provides an impressive contrast to the cities more traditional hotels. The hotel encompasses the finest in Scottish culture with luxury and style and provides an ideal base for those who wish to explore Scotland’s abundance of unique landmarks. The Glenmoriston Town House is conveniently just twenty minutes from Inverness Airport and only ten minutes walk from the city main line station.Experience unparalleled luxury in one of our 30 stylish bedrooms, designed with comfort in mind boasting heavenly beds, delicious duvets, fluffy towels and luxury toiletries not to mention the impeccable service you'd expect! Great food and wine are very much entwined in the Glenmoriston Town House experience and we offer an exceptional choice of restaurants. For a memorable culinary experience, visit the acclaimed Abstract - the only 3 AA Rosette hotel restaurant in Inverness – or try the chic and stylish informality of the Contrast Brasserie. In addition, the hotel’s destination Piano Bar offers Scotland’s finest whiskies from over 250 distilleries and our mixologists are constantly developing the most wonderful cocktails to tantalise even the most demanding taste buds.The Glenmoriston Town House will ensure a quality stay whether business or pleasure. Just over 3 hours from Edinburgh or Glasgow it is the perfect property for any number of occasions, be it family get together, sporting holiday, romantic escape, or just a break away from it all.
